intro: Alismorkis alta, commonly known as the high marsh clubmoss, is a small, evergreen fern-like plant belonging to the family Huperjaniaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves that form dense, mat-like growths on wet, acidic soils. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as bogs, swamps, and along stream banks. Alismorkis alta has a unique reproductive system, producing spores in specialized structures called sporangia. Its botanical features make it an important indicator species for wetland ecosystems.
